org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.opt

Class AbstractSimulation2

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.opt.AbstractSimulation2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Simulation2
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EfficientSimulation2, NaiveSimulation2, RefinedSimulation2, SchematicSimulation2

    public abstract class AbstractSimulation2
extends java.lang.Object
implements Simulation2
    This class provides a default implementation of Simulation2.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

      static boolean[][] getDirectTransitionSymbolSimulation(FSA aut1, State[] states1, FSA aut2, State[] states2)
      Returns an array b such that b[i][j] is true if and only if the outgoing transition symbols of states[i] in the first automaton are contained in the outgoing transition symbols of states[j] in the second automaton.
      static boolean[][] getFairSimulation(FSA aut1, State[] states1, FSA aut2, State[] states2)
      Returns an array b such that b[i][j] is true if and only if states[i] in the first automaton can be fairly simulated by states[j] in the second automaton.
      protected StateSet getPredecessors1(java.util.Set<State> set)
      Returns the predecessors of a set of states in the first label-on-state automaton from the cache.

      Returns an array b such that b[i][j] is true if and only if the incoming transition symbols of states[i] in the first automaton are contained in the incoming transition symbols of states[j] in the second automaton.
      static boolean[][] getStateSymbolSimulation(FSA aut1, State[] states1, FSA aut2, State[] states2)
      Returns an array b such that b[i][j] is true if and only if states[i] in the first automaton and states[j] in the second automaton have the same symbol.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractSimulation2

        public AbstractSimulation2(FSA aut1,
                           FSA aut2)
        Constructs this object to compute the simulation relation between two automata. The two automata are assumed to have the same label position, the same alphabet type, and the same acceptance condition. The fair simulation is taken into account.
        Parameters:
        aut1 - an automaton
        aut2 - an automaton

      • AbstractSimulation2

        public AbstractSimulation2(FSA aut1,
                           FSA aut2,
                           boolean fair)
        Constructs this object to compute the simulation relation between two automata. The two automata are assumed to have the same label position, the same alphabet type, and the same acceptance condition.
        Parameters:
        aut1 - an automaton
        aut2 - an automaton
        fair - true if the fair simulation should be considered

      • isDirectSimulated

        public boolean isDirectSimulated(State s1,
                                 State s2)
        Description copied from interface: Simulation2
        Returns true if a state in the first automaton can be directly simulated by another state in the second automaton. This method should be invoked after Simulation2.computeDirectSimulationRelation()
        Specified by:
        isDirectSimulated in interface Simulation2
        Parameters:
        s1 - a state in the first automaton
        s2 - a state in the second automaton
        Returns:
        true if s1 can be directly simulated by s2

                                  State s2)
        Description copied from interface: Simulation2
        Returns true if a state in the first automaton can be reversely simulated by another state in the second automaton. This method should be invoked after Simulation2.computeReverseSimulationRelation()
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        s1 - a state in the first automaton
        s2 - a state in the second automaton
        Returns:
        true if s1 can be reversely simulated by s2

      • isSimulated

        public boolean isSimulated()
        Description copied from interface: Simulation2
        Returns true if the first automaton is simulated by the second automaton. This method should be invoked after Simulation2.computeDirectSimulationRelation().
        Specified by:
        isSimulated in interface Simulation2
        Returns:
        true if the first automaton is simulated by the second automaton

      • getDirectTransitionSymbolSimulation

        public static boolean[][] getDirectTransitionSymbolSimulation(FSA aut1,
                                                              State[] states1,
                                                              FSA aut2,
                                                              State[] states2)
        Returns an array b such that b[i][j] is true if and only if the outgoing transition symbols of states[i] in the first automaton are contained in the outgoing transition symbols of states[j] in the second automaton.
        Parameters:
        aut1 - an automaton
        states1 - the states in aut1
        aut2 - an automaton
        states2 - the states in aut2
        Returns:
        an array indicating if the outgoing transition symbols of a state in the first automaton are contained in the outgoing transition symbols of another state in the second automaton

      • getReverseTransitionSymbolSimulation

        public static boolean[][] getReverseTransitionSymbolSimulation(FSA aut1,
                                                               State[] states1,
                                                               FSA aut2,
                                                               State[] states2)
        Returns an array b such that b[i][j] is true if and only if the incoming transition symbols of states[i] in the first automaton are contained in the incoming transition symbols of states[j] in the second automaton.
        Parameters:
        aut1 - an automaton
        states1 - the states in aut1
        aut2 - an automaton
        states2 - the states in aut2
        Returns:
        an array indicating if the incoming transition symbols of a state in the first automaton are contained in the incoming transition symbols of another state in the second automaton

      • getStateSymbolSimulation

        public static boolean[][] getStateSymbolSimulation(FSA aut1,
                                                   State[] states1,
                                                   FSA aut2,
                                                   State[] states2)
        Returns an array b such that b[i][j] is true if and only if states[i] in the first automaton and states[j] in the second automaton have the same symbol.
        Parameters:
        aut1 - an automaton
        states1 - the states in aut1
        aut2 - an automaton
        states2 - the states in aut2
        Returns:
        an array indicating if the outgoing transition symbols of a state in the first automaton are contained in the outgoing transition symbols of another state in the second automaton

      • getFairSimulation

        public static boolean[][] getFairSimulation(FSA aut1,
                                            State[] states1,
                                            FSA aut2,
                                            State[] states2)
        Returns an array b such that b[i][j] is true if and only if states[i] in the first automaton can be fairly simulated by states[j] in the second automaton. This method only considers the acceptance conditions.
        Parameters:
        aut1 - an automaton
        states1 - the states in aut1
        aut2 - an automaton
        states2 - the states in aut2
        Returns:
        an array indicating if a state can be simulated by another state in the acceptance condition

      • isFairStateSimulated

        public static boolean isFairStateSimulated(FSA aut1,
                                           State s1,
                                           FSA aut2,
                                           State s2)
        Returns true if a state in the first automaton is fair simulated by another state in the second automaton.
        Parameters:
        aut1 - an automaton
        s1 - a state in aut1
        aut2 - an automaton
        s2 - a state in aut2
        Returns:
        true if the state s1 is fair simulated by the state s2
